snippet: The canal authority and the construction consortium in charge of the project blame each other for $1.6 billion in cost overruns.
abstract: Work on the Panama Canal expansion project, already nine months behind schedule, is stopped after talks to resolve a dispute over $1.6 billion in cost overruns breaks down; authority and construction consortium in charge of project, led by Spanish construction firm Sacyr and including companies from Italy and Belgium, blame each other for the overruns.
lead_paragraph: The canal authority and the construction consortium in charge of the project blame each other for $1.6 billion in cost overruns.

headline.main: Cost Dispute Halts Work on Project to Expand Panama Canal
headline.print_headline: Cost Dispute Halts Work on Canal in Panama
